title: Costes Chair With High Back
body: Designed for the homonymous, now disappeared, parisian café, The Costes Chair with High Back owes its timeless success to the absoluteness of forms: a dark wooden embracing structure with three highly tilted legs. Designed by Phillipe Stark in 1984, The three legs on Philippe Starck’s classic chair are what make this design iconic. The three legs weren’t simply contrived for style – they served a purpose, that is to prevent waiters in the busy Parisian Cafe Costes from tripping.
